page.title: 02Peter Tavy:The Village
page.content: Peter Tavy is a small village on the edge of Dartmoor.There are several streams running through Peter Tavy, one of them contains trout.Most of the land around the village is used for grazing sheep and cattle.It is spread over quite a wide area of land but there are not many houses.A lot of the houses are old but there are a few new houses.Peter Tavy has an Anglican church and a Methodist chapel.The village has a weekly bus service to Tavistock and a post office which is also a shop.The village school has been closed and is being converted into a house.It is a changing village old people are moving out to smaller houses and young families are moving in.However Peter Tavy is quiet during the week days because most people are at work.
